credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous, Dr. and Mrs. Lewis Balamuth, Mr. and Mrs. Dewitt Clinton Cohen, Gertrude Crownfeld, Valerie Dreyfus, Norvin Hewitt Green, Rodman A. Heeren, Misses Hewitt, Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Florence N. Levy, Mrs. Paul C. Pennoyer, Mrs. Harry T. Peters, Mrs. Bernard Reis, Mrs. William Jay Schieffelin, and Mr. and Mrs. Stephens B. Stanton
title: Skirt
medium:
Medium: raffia palm fiber
Technique: buttonhole, stem-stitch, and cut-pile embroidery with withdrawn element work, on plain-weave foundation
description: This woman's ceremonial dance skirt has a center panel of dark purplish-brown with a design of interconnected diamonds with striped and dotted fillings created by buttonhole embroidery and withdrawn element work. A wide border on three sides has dark brown raffia cut-pile embroidery with interlacing patterns. Also on three sides, a heavy wrapped cord attached with a buttonhole variation in orange raffia, creates a form of ruffled edging.
name: Skirt
